required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate a Saw Bone Training Protocol in Using Tactile Sensation to Classify Bone Quality During Implant Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluate a Saw Bone Training Protocol in Using Tactile Sensation to Classify Bone Quality During Implant Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Bone quality is one of the major factors influencing the dental implant survival rate. Bone quality is believed to have effects on initial implant stability and success of osseointegration. Different implant designs and surgical protocols were developed for improving the survival rate in different bone quality. Although bone quality can be partly diagnosed by radiographic images, lots of experienced surgeons also evaluate bone quality with tactile sensation when they drill the bone. However, variations in evaluation of bone density maybe exist among different surgeons. For less experienced dentists, it is difficult to diagnose bone quality with tactile sensation in the beginning. This purpose of this study is to evaluate a training protocol in using tactile sensation to classify bone quality during implant surgery. Saw bones of variant densities are used as training materials. The outcomes before and after training will be compared. The effect of training frequency before surgery will also be evaluated.

detailed_description.textblock: Twenty-five dentists will be enrolled into the study. Tests will be performed using visual analog scale to score bone quality of test blocks.

primary_outcome.measure: Change on visual analog scale (VAS) score of each test block
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1st time point: test before training & test immediately after training; 2nd time point: 1 week after 1st time point (test after 1 wk); 3rd time point: 1 month after 2nd time point (test after 1month)
primary_outcome.description: Each VAS score performed on the specific test block will be compared between different time point.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Certified dentist with implant surgery experience less than 10 implants.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age exceed the limits
- Implant surgery experience more or equal to 10 implants

overall_official.last_name: Tong-Mei Wang Wang, DDS, MS, PhD

reference.citation: Friberg B, Sennerby L, Meredith N, Lekholm U. A comparison between cutting torque and resonance frequency measurements of maxillary implants. A 20-month clinical study. Int J Oral Maxillofac Surg. 1999 Aug;28(4):297-303.
Johansson P, Strid KG. Assessment of bone quality from cutting resistance during implant surgery. Internatioanl Journal of Oral & Maxillofacial implants 9:279-288, 1994
